alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Jackson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 3:46AM EDT until July 14 at 6:15AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Holmes County in the panhandle of Florida... Jackson County in the panhandle of Florida... * Until 515 AM CDT. * At 246 AM CDT, 911 Call Center reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Peanut Rd. Between 3.5 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 3 Hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...911 Call Center reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Graceville, Cottondale, Esto, Campbellton, Noma, Jacob City, Jacobs, Cobb Crossroads, Tendil Crossing, Noma Junction and Holland Crossroads. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
